[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::load_layout_from_cache()] [Partial Gas Charging Failure] If charging gas fails for one module in the layout's module list, are previous charges rolled back or do they stick? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::store_layout_to_cache()] [Cache Poisoning Attack] Can an attacker craft a transaction that stores incorrect layouts to the cache, causing subsequent transactions to use wrong struct sizes? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::store_layout_to_cache()] [Concurrent Cache Writes] What happens if multiple transactions try to store different layouts for the same StructKey simultaneously? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: FunctionDefinitionLoader::load_function_definition()] [Function Visibility Bypass] After loading a module, does get_function() properly check function visibility rules or can private functions be accessed? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: FunctionDefinitionLoader::load_function_definition()] [Module-Function Consistency] Between metered_load_module() and get_function(), can the module be modified causing a different function to be returned? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: NativeModuleLoader::charge_native_result_load_module()] [Native Gas Charging Consistency] Is the gas charged here consistent with gas charged in metered_load_module() for the same module? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: NativeModuleLoader::charge_native_result_load_module()] [Native Function Module Loading Limit] Is there a limit on how many modules a native function can load, or can it cause unbounded gas charges? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: ModuleMetadataLoader::load_module_for_metadata()] [Metadata Metering Difference] Unlike eager loader, lazy loader meters metadata access - does this break compatibility with code expecting unmetered access? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: ModuleMetadataLoader::load_module_for_metadata()] [Deserialized vs Verified Module] This loads deserialized modules - can metadata from unverified modules leak sensitive information? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: InstantiatedFunctionLoaderHelper::load_ty_arg()] [Type Argument Metering] Does metered_load_type() properly meter all nested type parameters in complex generic types? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: InstantiatedFunctionLoader::load_instantiated_function()] [Config Parameter Ignored] The _config parameter is ignored in lazy loading - can this cause semantic differences between eager and lazy modes? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: InstantiatedFunctionLoader::load_instantiated_function()] [Function Load Order] Does load_function_definition() charge gas before build_instantiated_function() loads type arguments, or vice versa? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: Loader::unmetered_module_storage()] [Native Context Exploitation] Native functions get unmetered storage access - what prevents them from performing expensive operations without gas charges? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: ScriptLoader::load_script()] [Config Ignored for Scripts] Script loading ignores LegacyLoaderConfig - does this cause inconsistent gas charging between eager and lazy modes? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: ScriptLoader::load_script()] [Script Verification Order] Is metered_verify_and_cache_script() called before build_instantiated_script(), ensuring scripts are verified before use? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: ScriptLoader::load_script()] [Type Argument Loading After Verification] Are type arguments loaded after script verification, and if so, can type argument loading fail after expensive verification? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/] [Eager vs Lazy Mode] [Gas Inconsistency] Can switching between eager and lazy loading modes mid-transaction cause different gas charges for identical operations, breaking determinism? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/] [Eager vs Lazy Mode] [Verification State Confusion] In eager mode, all dependencies are verified upfront; in lazy mode, verification is deferred - can this cause some modules to be used before full verification? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/] [Both Loaders] [Arc Reference Counting] Both loaders use Arc<Module> and Arc<Function> - can reference count overflow cause memory corruption with extremely high transaction volumes? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/] [Both Loaders] [RuntimeEnvironment Access] Both loaders access runtime_environment() through module_storage - can inconsistent environments cause determinism failures across validators? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/] [Both Loaders] [TraversalContext Mutation] Is TraversalContext properly isolated per transaction, or can concurrent transactions interfere with each other's traversal state? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/] [Both Loaders] [Script Caching] Both loaders cache scripts by hash - is the cache properly isolated between transactions or can cache poisoning affect multiple transactions? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/] [Both Loaders] [Error Type Conversion] Both convert between VMResult and PartialVMResult - can error information be lost in conversion, hiding attack indicators? (Low)
